This website is designed as a portal to information, benefits, resources, and activities offered by a variety of NYU offices, departments, and schools.                    New to New York City Find a pediatrician, register your child for school, identify child care, locate enrichment activities, and more. Read More                          Child-Friendly Activities New York City is filled with fun and educational activities indoors and out-of-doors. Read More                          Programs for Out-of School Time Enrichment opportunities are available from visual and performing arts to sports, music to science, and more. Finding and evaluating appropriate and affordable care can sometimes feel elusive. Parents are empowered when they have information and resources about the range of available child care options and the tools to identify and evaluate child care for their children newborn through school-age.     To assist you with your search, these web pages provide guidance to help you think about your needs, the various child care options, tools to use on tours and visits, as well as a sampling of local programs for newborns through school-age children.     NYU faculty, administrators, and staff benefit from 24/7 access to comprehensive nationwide information and referral services through our employee assistance provider, Carebridge Life Resources , 888-437-0911. Child and Family Policy Center - NYU Steinhardt                                                                     Skip to content              NYU Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development                                                 Child and Family Policy Center           Department of Applied Psychology                 About      What's Happening at the Center          Overview    Applied Research   Intervention Research   Professional Development   Forum Events              People    Career & Internship Opportunities    Contact                About The Center                        The Child and Family Policy Center at NYU Steinhardt works to bring state-of-the field knowledge about how to promote children's healthy development and school success to the forefront of policymaking, program design, and practice. Faculty and researchers affiliated with the Center conduct research, technical assistance, and research dissemination activities.    This work is supported by the School's multidisciplinary faculty, which includes scholars in child development, health, and education. The Center's primary focus is the well-being and healthy development of young children, age 0 to 8, in school, home, and community setttings.        LaRue Allen , Director NYU Steinhardt Kimball Hall, 246 Greene Street New York, NY 10003 212 998 5076 larue.allen@nyu.edu    Jennifer Astuto , Assistant Director NYU Steinhardt Kimball Hall, 246 Greene Street New York, NY 10003 212 992 9483 jennifer.astuto@nyu.edu       For all inquiries, please email cfpc@nyu.edu                             This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©          by New York University.
